description: This JSON schema describes the base UI configuration for the Ooyala Player, which can be customized in the skin.json file. Also see https://facebook.github.io/react and https://facebook.github.io/react-native.

general.description: Configuration of things that do not appear in only one part of the UI.

localization.description: Defines the string values used in the player. Languages listed in the array require a separate json file included in the bundle, named '<language>.json' e.g. 'en.json'.

startScreen.description: The screen displayed after an asset loads, but before playback begins.

playIconStyle.description: Defines the style of the play button icon. The default color is white with an opacity of 1.

showPromo.description: Show the promo image on the start screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

promoImageSize.description: Configure how large the promo image should be when displayed. The 'small' setting will use styling out of the style sheets.

showPlayButton.description: Show the play button on the start screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

playButtonPosition.description: Defines the position of the play button on the start screen.

showTitle.description: Show the video title on the start screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

showDescription.description: Show the video description on the start screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

titleFont.description: Defines the font of the video title on the start screen.  The default font family is Arial-Bold MT, the default size is 20, and the default color is white.

color.description: Any valid CSS color value (named colors, three-digit hex color, six-digit hex color, RGB colors).

descriptionFont.description: Defines the font of the video description on the start screen.  The default font family is ArialMT, the default size is 16, and the default color is white.

color.description: Any valid CSS color value (named colors, three-digit hex color, six-digit hex color, RGB colors).

infoPanelPosition.description: Defines the position of the information panel on the start screen.

pauseScreen.description: The screen displayed when playback is paused.

pauseIconStyle.description: Default color is white with an opacity of 1.

screenToShowOnPause.description: Defines the screen to show when the player is paused.

showPauseIcon.description: Show the pause icon on the pause screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

pauseIconPosition.description: Defines the position of the pause icon on the pause screen.

showTitle.description: Show the video title on the pause screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

showDescription.description: Show the video description on the pause screen if set to true.  Hide it if set to false.

infoPanelPosition.description: Defines the position of the information panel on the pause screen.

endScreen.description: The screen displayed after an asset has completed playing.

replayIconStyle.description: The default color is white with an opacity of 1.

color.description: Any valid CSS color value (named colors, three-digit hex color, six-digit hex color, RGB colors).

opacity.description: A floating-point number ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

screenToShowOnEnd.description: Defines the screen to show when the video playback has ended.

showReplayButton.description: Set to true to show the replay button on the end screen.  Set to false otherwise.

adScreen.description: The screen to show during ads playback

showAdMarquee.description: Show the ad marquee during ad playback is set to true, hide it if set to false.

showControlBar.description: Show the player control bar during ad playback if set to true.  Hide the control bar when a video ad is playing by setting showControlBar to false. If showControlBar is missing or set to true, the control bar will appear while an ad is playing on your player.

discoveryScreen.description: The screen showing other recommended content.

contentTitle.description: The setting for discovery content title

contentDuration.description: The setting for discovery content duration

shareScreen.description: The list of sharing buttons (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, etc.).

moreOptionsScreen.description: The more options / overflow panel. The set of items to show comes from the 'buttons' part of the schema.

iconStyle.description: Default color is white with an opacity of 1

upNext.description: The screen to show as an asset is ending, indicating what assets can follow.

showUpNext.description: Optional parameter used to show the Up Next screen if set to true, or hide the screen if set to false.
showUpNext.default: If no value is provided for showUpNext and timeToShow, showUpNext will default to false.

timeToShow.description: Optional floating-point parameter used to set the time relative to the video length to show the Up Next screen. When timeToShow is set to a value greater than 1.0, the player interprets that number as the number of seconds before the end of the video to show the Up Next screen. However, when timeToShow is less than 1.0, the player treats the decimal value as a percentage of the video length and shows the Up Next screen at that point in the video. For example, if timeToShow is set to 0.9 in a 60-second video, the Up Next screen will show at 54 seconds. If timeToShow is set to 5.0 in a 60-second video, the Up Next screen will show at 55 seconds.
timeToShow.default: If showUpNext is set to true and no value is given for timeToShow, the Up Next dialog will default to showing 10 seconds prior to the end of the video. If no value is given for showUpNext, or it is set to false, the value set in timeToShow has no effect because the Up Next screen is never shown.

controlBar.description: The playback control bar. Generally contains a play-pause button, scrubber control, etc. The set of items to show comes from the 'buttons' part of the schema.

iconStyle.description: The default color is #8E8E8E with an opacity of 1.

color.description: Any valid CSS color value (named colors, three-digit hex color, six-digit hex color, RGB colors).

opacity.description: A floating-point number ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).

autoHide.description: The control bar is automatically hidden during video playback when the mouse is not in the control bar area if and only if this parameter is set to true.

watermark.description: An object that defines the content and position of the watermark image on the control bar.

buttons.description: Defines the buttons that can appear on the controlBar and/or the moreOptions panel. Desktop and Mobile platforms can be configured individually.

icons.description: The set of all required icons, for rendering all the various buttons' states.

color.description: Any color string as supported by React / React Native.

image.description: Specify how to obtain an image's data. Desktop will use the url. Mobile will first lookup the native resource, with fall back to the url.

controlBarButton.description: Buttons that start off in the control bar and thus need to say how they react when the control bar is too narrow for them to fit.

whenDoesNotFit.description: Sets how the button should be dealt with when it doesn't fit in the control bar. Keep: keep the button visible in the control bar. Drop: hide it from the UI. MoveToMoreOptions: show it in the more options / overflow UI.

moreOptionsButton.description: Buttons that only appear in the more options UI, and never leave.

buttonNames.description: These are the only buttons currently supported by the UI SDK.

buttonArray.description: Used to list the buttons for a single platform (desktop vs. mobile).

icon.description: Icons are renderable from fonts. Bitmaps are not supported.

fontFamilyName.description: The name of the font family to use.

fontString.description: The string used for displaying the icon. (Usually a single Unicode code point.)

fontStyleClass.description: The CSS class string for displaying the icon, which only applies to HTML5 player

iconStyle.description: A collection of styles that can be used by icon renderings throughout the UI. Any value placed in here gets directly parsed as a React stylesheet. Supported style customizations are color, opacity, shadowColor, shadowOffset, shadowOpacity, shadowRadius, borderColor, borderRadius, and borderStyle. See React stylesheets for more specifics on each field. All values are optional, and have defaults specified in the code depending on the section. See each section for default values.
